content: ADF files are saved with an .ALF lookup file, which contains metadata required to navigate, backup, and restore the ACT! database. ADF files may also be archived within ACT! database backups, which use the .BAK extension. ADF files use Microsoft SQL Server formatting and are similar to .MDF files.
NOTE: Sage ACT! became Swiftpage Act! in 2013.

description: A file with .adf extension is a database file created with ACT CRM (Customer Relationship Management) software to store relationship data about customers. It stores information about customerâ€™s name, email, contact, business information, and relationship history. CRM systems are more often integrated with call centres established by businesses to automatically retrieve user information for incoming calls. ADF files can be opened with SwiftPage ACT software on Windows OS.

An ADF file is a database file created by ACT!, a customer relationship management (CRM) application. It contains customer contact data such as names, email addresses, business information, and the relationship history. ADF files are used for customer relations information in a structured format.
